Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶

Asynchronous context manager for setting up lifespan events.

Parameters:

app (FastAPI) – FastAPI application instance.

main.read_root()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

class src.repository.contacts.ContactsDB(db: Session)¶

Bases: object

Handles database operations related to contacts.

async create_contact(user: Users, contact: ContactModel) → Contacts¶

Creates a new contact for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (Users) – User object.

  • contact (ContactModel) – Contact data.

Returns:

Newly created contact object.

Return type:

Contacts

async delete_contact(user: Users, contact_id: int) → None¶

Deletes a contact.

Parameters:

  • user (Users) – User object.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

async filter_objects(objects: Query, **kwargs) → Query¶

Filters Query objects based on provided key-value pairs.

Parameters:

  • objects (Query[Contacts]) – Query objects to filter.

  • kwargs (dict) – Key-value pairs for filtering.

Returns:

Filtered Query objects.

Return type:

Query[Contacts]

async get_contact(user: Users, contact_id: int) → Contacts | None¶

Retrieves a specific contact belonging to a user.

Parameters:

  • user (Users) – User object.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

Returns:

Contact object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Contacts | None

Retrieves contacts based on provided filters.

Parameters:

kwargs (dict) – Filtering criteria.

Returns:

List of filtered contacts.

Return type:

list[Contacts]

async get_contacts_objects() → Query¶

Retrieves all contacts from the database.

Returns:

Query object for contacts.

Return type:

Query[Contacts]

Updates an existing contact.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactModel) – Updated contact data.

  • contact_obj (Contacts) – Contact object to update.

Returns:

Updated contact object.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user)) → CreateContact¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactModel) – Contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

  • current_user (Users) – Current user object.

Returns:

Response containing the newly created contact.

Return type:

CreateContact

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user)) → DeleteContact¶

Delete contact of current user by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

  • current_user (Users) – Current user object.

Returns:

Response indicating successful deletion of the contact.

Return type:

DeleteContact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactResponse¶

Retrieve the current user’s contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

  • current_user (Users) – Current user object.

Returns:

Response containing the contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(name: str = '', surname: str = '', email_address: str = '', db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user)) → ListContactsResponse¶

Retrieve contacts for the current user with optional filtering by name, surname, or email address.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Filter by name.

  • surname (str) – Filter by surname.

  • email_address (str) – Filter by email address.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

  • current_user (Users) – Current user object.

Returns:

Response containing a list of contacts.

Return type:

ListContactsResponse

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_birthday(days_to_birthday: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user)) → ListContactsResponse¶

Retrieve the contacts of the current user whose birthdays fall within the specified number of days from the current date.

Parameters:

  • days_to_birthday (int) – Number of days to include before the birthday.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

  • current_user (Users) – Current user object.

Returns:

Response containing a list of contacts with birthdays within the specified range.

Return type:

ListContactsResponse

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user)) → UpdateContact¶

Update a specific contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactModel) – Updated contact data.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

  • current_user (Users) – Current user object.

Returns:

Response containing the updated contact information.

Return type:

UpdateContact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the specified contact is not found.

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user)) → UserModel¶

Get the details of the current logged-in user.

Parameters:

current_user (Users) – Current user object.

Returns:

Details of the current user.

Return type:

UserModel

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → UserModel¶

Update the avatar of the current logged-in user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – Uploaded image file for the avatar.

  • current_user (Users) – Current user object.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Updated user object with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserModel

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → StringResponse¶

Endpoint for confirming user email using token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Confirmation token.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Response indicating email confirmation status.

Return type:

StringResponse

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If there’s an error during verification.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → TokenModel¶

Endpoint for user login.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm containing username and password.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Response containing access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the username or password is invalid, or the email is not confirmed.

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → TokenModel¶

Endpoint for refreshing access token using refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Response containing new access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the refresh token is invalid.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → StringResponse¶

Endpoint for resend confirmation email if email is not confirmed.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – RequestEmail containing email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks instance for running tasks asynchronously.

  • request (Request) – FastAPI Request instance.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Response indicating email confirmation status or request to check email for confirmation.

Return type:

StringResponse

async src.routes.auth.signup(background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, body: UserSingupModel, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → UserResponse¶

Endpoint to sign up a new user.

Parameters:

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks instance for running tasks asynchronously.

  • body (UserSingupModel) – User signup data.

  • request (Request) – FastAPI Request instance.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Response containing the newly created user details.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException 409 – If the account already exists.

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Class for handling authentication related operations.

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶

Creates an access token based on the provided data.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode into the token.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Optional expiration delta for the token.

Returns:

Encoded access token.

Return type:

str

async create_email_token(data: dict) → str¶

Creates a token for email verification based on the provided data.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Data to encode into the token.

Returns:

Encoded email verification token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶

Creates a refresh token based on the provided data.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode into the token.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Optional expiration delta for the token.

Returns:

Encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Decode the provided refresh token and return the user ID.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – Refresh token to decode.

Returns:

Decoded user ID.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token’s scope is invalid or the credentials cannot be validated.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Users¶

Retrieve the current user based on the provided access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Access token.

  • db (Session) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Current user object.

Return type:

Users

Raises:

HTTPException – If the credentials cannot be validated or the user is not found.

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str¶

Decodes the provided email verification token and return the email address.

Parameters:

token (str) – Email verification token.

Returns:

Decoded email address.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid for email verification.

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Generates a hashed version of the provided password.

Parameters:

password (str) – Password to hash.

Returns:

Hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

Verify whether the provided plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Plain text password.

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password.

Returns:

Boolean indicating whether the passwords match.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email for email verification.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – Username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – Host URL for email verification link.

REST API schemas¶

src.schemas.valid_number(phone_number: str | None)¶

Validates the phone number and returns it in international format if valid.

Parameters:

phone_number (str | None) – Phone number to validate.

Returns:

Validated phone number in international format.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If the phone number is invalid.
